name: 3Copy of AI Haircare Advisor
description: Get a personalized haircare routine based on a detailed questionnaire, an AI analysis of your hair & scalp, and your goals. Powered by Google Gemini.
prompt:
Analyze the given image and identify all visible **hair and scalp conditions**.
Detect and classify conditions from the categories below, give bounding boxes or polygon coordinates where applicable, and provide a structured JSON output according to the specified schema.

-------------------
CATEGORIES YOU MUST DETECT
-------------------
Hair Loss Types:
Common Types:
Androgenetic Alopecia (Genetic / Pattern Hair Loss)
Telogen Effluvium (stress/illness related shedding)
Anagen Effluvium (chemotherapy induced)
Alopecia Areata (autoimmune, patchy bald spots)
Traction Alopecia (from tight hairstyles)
Cicatricial Alopecia (Scarring types)
Trichotillomania (compulsive hair pulling)
Diffuse Alopecia (systemic causes)
Tinea Capitis (fungal infection)
Types More Common in Men:
Male Pattern Baldness (receding hairline + crown thinning)
Crown & Vertex Baldness
Types More Common in Women:
Female Pattern Hair Loss (diffuse thinning, widened part)
Postpartum Hair Loss
Menopausal Hair Loss
PCOS-related Hair Loss

Scalp Conditions:
- Seborrheic Dermatitis
- Dandruff (Mild Seborrhea)
- Psoriasis
- Tinea Capitis (Fungal)
- Folliculitis / Folliculitis Decalvans
- Xerosis (Dry Scalp)
- Oily Scalp / Sebaceous Hypersecretion
- Contact / Atopic Dermatitis
- Pityriasis Amiantacea
- Cradle Cap (Infant)

Hair Shaft Disorders:
- Trichorrhexis Nodosa
- Monilethrix
- Pili Torti
- Loose Anagen Hair
- Bubble Hair
- Split Ends / Weathering

Infestations:
- Pediculosis Capitis (Lice / Nits)
- Demodex Infestation

Cosmetic Quality:
- Frizz, Porosity, Product Build-up, Color Damage, Heat Damage, Breakage

Hair & Scalp Typing:
- Hair Density (Low / Medium / High)
- Hair Fiber Thickness (Fine / Medium / Coarse)
- Curl Type (1Aâ€“4C)
- Scalp Type (Dry / Normal / Oily / Combination)

-------------------
ZONES (for localization)
-------------------
- frontal_scalp
- temporal_scalp
- vertex/crown
- parietal
- occipital
- central
- hairline
- general_scalp
